text:
On linux, I am having some weird problems, where if I have a class in a jar 
file the TOMCAT_HOME/lib directory and I have another file in a webapp/WEB-
INF/lib directory, the classes in the two jar files won't interact properly. 
For example, the jakarta taglibs mailer tag library depends on the mail.jar and 
activation.jar tag libraries. When the mailer.jar file is in the webapp/WEB-
INF/lib directory and one of the other two is in the TOMCAT_HOME/lib directory, 
I get an error when trying to use the mailer tag library, whcih is a known 
JavaMail error that indicates that either the mail.jar file or the 
activation.jar file is not in the classpath.

Additionally, when I try to load a properties file using a ClassLoader from a 
class in the TOMCAT_HOME/lib directory and the properties file is located in 
the classes directory of the webapp, it cannot find the properties file.

My configuration is one where many class files are located in the 
TOMCAT_HOME/lib directory and then I have about 10 or so virtual hosts with 
webapps located at the root level of each host.
creator: gabe@groundzero.com

text:
This isn't so much a bug as a feature.  The classes in tomcat/lib and 
webapps/WEB-INF/lib are loaded by different class loaders.  The class loader 
for tomcat/lib has no way to load classes found in webapps/WEB-INF/lib.  You'll 
either have to put all the jars in tomcat/lib or in each webapp.

Class loading has improved quite a bit in TC 4.0 so you might want to 
investigate switching to that version.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
